snippet: In a trend that is surprising pollsters and jangling the nerves of Republicans, a majority of young people embraces President Obama’s notion that government can be a constructive force.
abstract: Majority of young people in Montana are surprising pollsters and making Republicans nervous, as they embrace more liberal ideologies and Pres Obama's notion that big government can be a constructive force for the country; voters under age 30 have helped elect several statewide candidates; nationally, young voters have, since 2004, been casting their ballots for Democrats by far wider margins than previous generations in a shift that could reshape politics for decades.
lead_paragraph: In a trend that is surprising pollsters and jangling the nerves of Republicans, a majority of young people embraces President Obama’s notion that government can be a constructive force.

headline.seo: In Montana, Young, Liberal and Open to Big Government
headline.main: Young, Liberal and Open to Big Government
headline.print_headline: A Growing Trend: Young, Liberal And Open to Big Government
